required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Patent Foramen Ovale Closure With the AMPLATZER PFO OCCLUDER in Patients With Recurrent Cryptogenic Stroke Due to Presumed Paradoxical Embolism Through a Patent Foramen Ovale Who Have Failed Conventional Drug Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: Closure of Patent Foramen Ovale with the AMPLATZERÂ® PFO OCCLUDER in patients with at least two cryptogenic strokes due to presumed paradoxical embolism through a patent foramen ovale and who have failed conventional therapy.

detailed_description.textblock: The primary objective of the PFO Access Registry is to allow access to the AMPLATZER PFO Occluder in subjects with a PFO who have already experienced at least two cryptogenic strokes due to presumed paradoxical embolism through a patent foramen ovale and who have failed conventional drug therapy.

intervention.intervention_name: Device closure with the AMPLATZER PFO Occluder
intervention.description: Device closure with the AMPLATZER PFO Occluder

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patent foramen ovale (PFO); recurrent cryptogenic stroke; failed antiplatelet/anticoagulant therapy
Exclusion Criteria:
International normalized ration (INR) outside of 2-3; intracardiac thrombus (subjects may be enrolled after resolution of thrombus)
